Reviews.Title: “What a dive”
Reviews.Author: myalfagt
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. The lad on reception was very pleasant and helpful. The stairs off reception are fantastic with a wood carved balustrade. Once you reach the first floor you are greeted with threadbare carpet patched with gaffa tape and filth on the walls, I have photographs so if the management want to deny don't. A carpet Hoover was stored on the landing now this must be some kind of joke, hygiene is not on the agenda here. The room was appalling, the en suite was a fibre glass pod which was filthy. The carpet had a pub feel, sticky carpets and the view was non existent. This hotel should be razed to the ground it is the worst place that I have ever stayed and that includes bus shelters and fields when I was a drunk student. Do not waste your money, yes this place is cheap for central London but what a hole, stay away do not stay here. The pub across the road is fab get your self tanked up that way you will not notice the carpets or filth on the walls. If you do decide to stay, then the best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “good location but very basic!!”
Reviews.Author: loravas
Reviews.Content: The position is very convenient, just opposite Paddinton train/underground station and various bus stops too. The staff overall was helpful. The lift is still out of service. We were on the second floor so not easy climbing the stairs with the suitcases. The double room we had overlooking the main road was very small. just a double bed, a two-door wardrobe,tv and small table all crumpled together, hardly any space to walk around. The shower room..interesting enough was a caravan/yacht piece literally placed in the room, so you can imagine ow tiny it was. Can't complain about the cleanliness, all around the hotel it was clean and tidy, towels changed everyday. Breakfast was served in a small room but we never waited long to be seated. orange juice and coffe /tea and toast offered twice. then choice betwen continental (yoghurt, muesli/cornflakes and 2 slices ham + 2 slices cheese) or english (2 sausages, beans, mushrooms, 1 slice bacon and egg). English breakfast was listed as a 2pounds supplement. My boyfriend had it twice but at the end we were not charged for it. Overall it was a nice stay besides that we only use the room for showering and sleep and maybe a short rest in between. But still find that it was expensive especially for the size of room and no functional lift. I know overall London is very expensive re accomodation, but for the same amount of money i always got a good sizeable room, bathroom and better services( lift and breakfast buffet) in 3 or 4 star hotels in other european capitals. as far this was the worst room i ever got. i don't think i will stay her again if some other time i return to London.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Rempt2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in February on our way to Spain. 5 minutes from Paddington. Nice Restaurants nearby (Dickens Tavern and Sawyer Arms). Only issue was lack of lift. I requested lower floors but even though we got second there were stairs going up and down before we reached our room. It felt like we were on the 4th floor. Wouldn't recommend place to people who have problems lugging baggage up stairs; otherwise place was clean. Restaurants mentioned were good. You order drinks and food from bar in both places and give them your table #. You take drinks to table and they deliver food (all good). Both places had nice ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: happytravelerderby
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel everything looked great until we noticed the lift not working but by the sounds of it other people ave said this in their reviews over three years so it may be it has never been sorted. Our room was not ready when we arrived but we were early so we went into central london to see friends. On arrival back to the hotel we were oold where our room was after trodging up 4 flights of stairs carperts threadbare paint peeling off skirting boards all the way up to our room. The bedroom was in a bad way the carpet was heavily stained right through the room . The curtains were dirty also i dont think the windowas had see a wash for years. In the bathroom there was mold al over the ceiling, the bath had chips out of it, There was no shower curtain aroundn the bath and NO slip mat in the bath which is a HEALTH & SAFETY issue. So at 23:15 i was demanding my money back even after being told to go and check another room bearing in mind there was 3 in our party and this room only had 2 beds. At first i was only offered £40 refund but got the lot back after the very nice gentleman sorted it out after the original reception person walked off and left him to it. VERY PROFESSIONAL NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Good Nights Rest”
Reviews.Author: CardiffNicky
Reviews.Content: I always use the Royal Norfolk Hotel on brief stays to London. It is close to the arrival station Paddington am,always greeted by freindly staff. The only negative point is that in three seperate stays over three years the lift has been out of order, The twin room that my friend and I stayed in was very small with a caravan like bathroom. However for the online rate of Â£64 was superb as we only wanted the room as a base and to have a good nights rest which we had without any problem. The room was warm the beds comfortable. We did not have breakfast as we woke up to late. I shall definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wehay2003
Reviews.Content: I paid Â£45.00 for a single room but ended up in a triple room a double and single beds with breakfast and ensuite so that was great annoyed though i turned up at hotel and had to go across the road to use internet to get that rate or Â£70.00 at hotel check in anyway checked in quite easiliy but NO LIFT now thats not good as the stairs were long there was a lift but wasnt working room was fine terrible squeaky floorboards tho bathroom ok very basic shower is an add on to bath taps and not brill bathroom floor could off been cleaner tv in room and bed was ok overall an ok stay would stay again as great location central in paddington and check out is midday didnt get breakfast so cannot comment on this. internet is Â£8.50 for 24 hours

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicky215
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 10 paces from paddington tube- superb location The hotel inside is very poor I paid Â£72 per night even factoring in the fantastic location close to tube it's still worth no more thanÂ£50 per night

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING ROYAL ABOUT THE NORFOLK.”
Reviews.Author: ipswichjimlee
Reviews.Content: We have just spent two nights at the royal norfolk hotel, on our arrival we were greeted by friendly staff on reception, who gave us our room key (341) & were given directions to find our room. The lift was out of order & apparently had been for some time. It was a bit of an assault course to get to our room, up one flight of stairs, down another then up again.It would be a real struggle if you were elderly or disabled. I would have thought the hotel would have laid on staff to carry your bags. When we finally reached our room, to say we were disappointed would be an understatement, the room looked tired & in need of a refurb. We had booked a double room, but this was at best a single with a double bed in it. The room could only have measured 10ft x 8ft with just enough room to walk around the bed. The heating didn't work, the windows were not double glazed, so the draught whistled through the gaps. The walls were paper thin, you could hear everything coming from the adjoining rooms The so called ensuite was a joke, i have seen bigger bathrooms in a caravan. As for breakfast the breakfast room was far too small for the number of guest rooms only 10 tables, you had to wait outside for a table. When we finally got a table, the choice of menu was poor, the full english was made up of sausage bacon egg mushrooms beans & toast, made from very poor quality ingredients, probably supermarket own brand value range. As we paid Â£99 per night you would have expected something better for your money. The hotels only redeeming feature was its good location right next to paddington station. If youre looking to book a hotel in the paddington area there are plenty of other hotels in paddington, book the royal norfolk as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jomagcin1
Reviews.Content: The royal Norfolk is in a great position for all amenities around London. The hotel itself is clean, tidy, friendly atmosphere and good value. The breakfast is just right amount and the staff will gladly oblige with extra tea and coffee. The pub joined on to the hotel is great as there is an entrance from the side so guests don't have to go out then in again, The meals are plentifull and good value for London at least. The beers ar not watered down like some places. The room is small but adequate with a tv and bathroom and tea/coffee making fascilites. The only grudge is the lift not working. WE were on the 4th floor and being in our 50's and one of us dissabled this was extremely dificult. All in all I would return to this hotel if given a lower level room.

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: terry056
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location. the main line station and underground are 1 minute walk away. the hotel serves agood breakfast. the rooms are a bit small the staff are very friendly and we would stay here again for a short break .

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here”
Reviews.Author: Griffsr
Reviews.Content: Cheap and cheerful, ideal as there is so much to do in London it's pointless spending loads on an expensive hotel, breakfast nice wish they would fix the lift tho!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best trips to London ever!”
Reviews.Author: Lara267
Reviews.Content: Situation of the hotel is amazing! very effecient staff and some restaurant close by are very good! The bed is soo comfortable would lhave loved to take it with me home! One bad thing about the room is that we had a high floor room which was a bit of a hassel to take up shopping bags everyday. It was a nightmare when we had to take down luggages at 04:00am on check out day. Other than that the stay was amazing and so was the breakfast! well done to all!

Reviews.Title: “good service and great location”
Reviews.Author: newforestsway
Reviews.Content: The Royal Norfolk hotel is located about 1 minute walk from Paddington tube station. If you are looking for a tour bus they stop on London st. just at the corner. The rooms are quite comfortable and alway very clean. Many of the cleaning and breakfast room staff are either Romanian or Polish. You will find them to be very friendly especially if you greet them in their native language. The breakfast room always had people waiting to get in unless you are an early riser but the atmosphere was very pleasant, the food was great and the staff were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: mrsgoddis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on 25th October for a 2 night break. After reading the reviews we were slightly worried, however when we arrived the first thing i thought was great location. When we checked in the staff were pleasant. Our room was on the first floor, so we were lucky as the stairs were rather high. The room was small but clean and good enough for what we needed. The bathroom was very small but again, it was good enough. Breakfast was nice except for the garlic mushrooms, little odd to me. Overall, i would say the Royal Norfolk is a nice little hotel and very good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not for ME - Never again”
Reviews.Author: Terry G
Reviews.Content: Booked in for two nights, ready for home after the first, my single room was very small, on 3rd floor no lift, TV set was very old dated back to the 60s. Bathoom so small could no move in it (more room in bathroom on a cruise ships). Some of the staff on reception had take it or leave it attitude. Look around you can do better for the price this hotel charges.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read”
Reviews.Author: mmccoy1730
Reviews.Content: Our daughter and ourselves had a great experiece at the Royal Norfolk. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to Paddington Station. We had to take the Heathrow Express for an early flight to Dublin and wanted to be as close as possible to Paddington Station. It was literally feet away! True the bathroom was small but we expected that. The room was as clean as a whistle . The beds were so comfortable we could have slept our time away, but too much to do in London. The breakfast was very good. We cannot understand complaints. Most of all the management was so polite. They gave us a room on the second floor as we had asked and helped us with luggage. I would highly recommend the Royal Norfolk if you want to stay in central London.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job.”
Reviews.Author: rachelem89
Reviews.Content: My mum and I checked into the Royal Norfolk on 07/10/2011, and we booked for two nights on the basis of the price and location (2 mins from Paddington Station). We had a twin room on the 4th floor. The lady on the reception desk was extremely friendly and welcoming, and explained that the lift was currently out of order (we were expecting this from reading other reviews). To get the the 4th floor requires climbing up about 8 flights of very steep narrow steps - not an easy feat with bulky bags!! On first impressions, the room was dated, but clean and tidy. The beds were actually really comfortable, with fresh clean sheets. We had a view over Norfolk Square & London Street. There was a little kettle and 2 mugs, and a little tin containing coffee, tea milk and sugar. This was nice, but didn't get topped up during our stay so we ended up buying our own. The room also had a hairdryer (I'll use the word hairdryer loosely!) and a TV. The bathroom was appauling. It can only be described as a 'caravan bathroom' and was basically a small plastic pod put into the room in the corner, it couldn't have been any bigger than 70cm square. It was so small, you couldn't use the shower without flooding the tiny room and using the toilet was interesting!!! There are towels supplied, but these are VERY small so I would reccommend bringing your own. We had a cooked breakfast included with our room, which was very poor. The sausages were tiny, and the really cheap kind which had the texture of wallpaper paste inside (there may have been traces of meat somewhere!) the mushrooms were undercooked and cooked in oil and garlic, which for breakfast is vile. The beans were very much of the value variety and the single egg you get is overcooked and very small. However the selection of toasts and spreads was nice, as was the orange juice and coffee. On both mornings we had to wait for over 20 minutes for a table, and we felt like we were being rushed to eat and get out to free a table up. Overall, its an OK hotel. If you just want a place for a shower and a bed its fine. I would reccommend leaving breakfast and popping to McDonalds or Costa Coffee around the corner from the hotel. Location is fantastic, Paddington station is a 2 minute walk away, right next to the underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Reaching 4th floor is grueling”
Reviews.Author: mrcrisco
Reviews.Content: I checked in yesterday at 2 pm, and after I paid for the room I was informed that it was on the 4th floor, and, by the way, that the lift was not working. The lady at the desk offered rather unhelpfully that I could leave my suitcase at the desk, and take whatever I would need for the night out of it. Probably unwisely I decided to go ahead and decided to lug my suitcase upstairs. You see, I am 66 and have a bad back, and something like that could easily send me to the hospital... The lady led me to the 1st floor where the breakfast room is, and then pointed to the beginning of the stairs, leading up to the 4th floor. This is a very complicated maze, as the hotel is made up of several smallish buildings. You end up going through about 3 doors on the way up. Furthermore, at one point you must actually go down about 1 floor before you can go up again... The stairs are narrow, steep, and make frequent sharp turns. All in all, reaching the 4th floor is the worst climb that I have ever experienced in any hotel, bar none! I checked out at 10 this morning , and the lift was still broken, so I had to redo the whole thing backwards. I noticed some Asian women asking at the desk about some other hotels with working lifts. I wish I had done the same! In their defence, the manager told me that they do not advertise the lift, and so I had no ground for seeking some discount (which I didi). I guess that legally he is right. But then I do have the right to write a review about this nasty experience, and so I am exercising this right ... If you want to stay there, make sure that you reserve a room on a low floor if at all possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Lodging”
Reviews.Author: IdebMalta_Europe
Reviews.Content: The excellent location, just a minute walk from the station is just about it. The hotel needs some serious refurbishment. All furniture is old and sometimes even shabby. It is a good place to stay in if you plan to only sleep and shower there. It is definitely not the place where to stay if you plan to spend a lot of time in the room. The rooms are very small and even smaller are the bathrooms, which unfortunately have no ventilation at all. The TV works however forget seeing a remote control anywhere around. All in all everything is clean but even though the room gets cleaned every day (whether you want t or not), it is never vacuum cleaned. Breakfast is either continental or English (at an extra cost of Â£2). Waiters in the breakfast room tend to be quite rude.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go again”
Reviews.Author: ja55e
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to Paddington station, but thatÂ´s it. My advice is to look for another hotel, since there is a lot of them in this neighborhood. The hotel staff is not British, my guess is that they are mostly from Russia, and I would not say they were rude, but I did not feel welcome at all, it eas almost we werent there at all. Our room was tiny, which is common for London hotels, but the shower was ridiculous, it was so small I could not use our room shower at all, and had to use the one in our hotel corridor. Look for another option, you will surely find a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if travelling via Paddington, but that is all”
Reviews.Author: Howard63
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on my way back from a holiday with my son, in order to see London the next day. GOOD POINTS: - Location, Luggage Store, Pleasant breakfast waitresses, reasonable price, not too noisy IN NEED OF IMPROVEMENT: - no lift, so carting heavy suitcases up several flights, with no apology or offer or help Entrance and first impressions: - shabby, stained carpets, everything needing a revamp, bedroom only one lightbulb out of 3 working, shower broken so could not stand under it, door handle missing from wardrobe, basic breakfast - but by then expectations of anything more had gone Customer service in reception - none existent on arrival, better when leaving I think this hotel survives on non-repeat guests, and therefore cares little about those coming for a one night stay. Luggage stores was a big plus, but no record was made of what we had left, and we were given the key to the store to help ourselves when we returned so could have helped ourselves to a much smarter case!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but next time we go, we'll ask for a porter!”
Reviews.Author: lolidov
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. The positive thing is it's very well located: just opposite Paddington!. And less than 40 minutes walk to the very centre: West End, Trafalgar Sq., Buckingham, etc are quite close, but if you prefer not to walk you have very good connections, both by bus an tube. As for the rooms, although it is quite an old building, they are well furnished and clean and the bathroom is clean too! We had clean bedclothing and towels every day. Furthermore, the breakfast has a good selection of food (except for the fact that you aren't given any pieces of fruit), and you can choose between an English or continental breakfast. On the other hand, we were given rooms on the very top of the building: 4th floor, which was more the 5th, since each of the floors have two different levels and, believe it of not, the lift didn't work, so we had to carry all our luggage up to the very top, which was really exhausting. On the last day, we were told that we should have asked for a porter and I was shocked because they should have told us, since we complained about having to carry our suitcases by ourselves! So, if you go, remember to ask for a porter because they might not tell you! To sum us, I will recommed this hotel because it is quite economical, well situated and clean, but try to get a room on the first floor!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear!”
Reviews.Author: Scorpiolady92995
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from this hotel. Ok, you get what you pay for - simple as. If you want plush and style - book The Hilton. Great location, right opposite Paddington train Station and The Underground. Good selection of shops and bars around the area. The hotel itself - staff very friendly, hard working and helpful. The rooms although small were adequate - bathroom (shower and loo) VERY small! The whole property could do with a facelift to be honest - but we only slept there! We were allocated a twin room on the fourth floor - couldnt find it at first, we climbed all the stairs, could go no further, then found a door leading to the outside, a bridge to cross over to another part of the building _ never have I come across this at any other hotel!!!! We opened the door (423) and was immediately hit by the most awful smell ever come across! Seemed to be above the bins with obviously rotten waste. No way could we have stayed there. I contacted reception and fair play, we were moved straight away - to third floor - slightly better for our breathing! The rooms were both clean and tidy, but on the small side. My biggest problem was - LIFT OUT OF ORDER! I see from other reviews this has been an ongoing problem. The stairs were a nightmare, anyone with walking difficulties would have been disastrous. Surely the management should made this repair work as a matter of urgency????

Reviews.Title: “so small...”
Reviews.Author: milou27
Reviews.Content: Location is great, one step from metro, and from Paddington station, not far from Hyde park, quite nice. But...I think I never saw such a small room and bathroom is just microscopic! but it was clean and people at reception were nice and ready to answer to all questions we asked for it was our first time in London. Breakfast was good and there was enough to eat : cereals, toasted bread, marmelades, butter, ham, chease, no sweets but this is good for dieta, no fruit (sniff), tea or coffee . People who worked there are kind enough and serv breakfast at once when you sit down. The hotel is in 2 pieces I would say not very new, but we were going there just to sleep! Steps are old too and of course lift doesn't work..we were on last floor. But as it was clean. As location is perfect hope to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: T0nyB
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value hotel near Paddington station - a little out of central London to the North West. Not very well staffed, but the staff are pleasant and cheerful. The single room was clean but very small and the shower area was obviously an afterthought. The deal included breakfast, but when I turned up, there was a queue of about 20 people for the breakfast room - so I skipped breakfast. There is a very noisy pub opposite, and at the time of my visit it was filled with football revellers,

Reviews.Title: “staffs need to be loosen up”
Reviews.Author: garfieldsiu
Reviews.Content: pros: great location, walking distance to the Metro Station, safe neighborhood, reasonable room space, good breakfast cons: staffs are too cold, they speak without open thier mouths! Minimal assistance, below standard welcome greeting. Even I tried to get them to talk, they would just answered with one or two words. If they are so not happy of what they're doing, then go do something else!. The bathroom is so so tiny, I could barely turn myself around even I am a small size person. I am wonder what if a standard 5'10" and 180lb male can do inside the shower area. No A/C conditioner, could be tough during the hot summer. No remote control for the TV??

Reviews.Title: “Everything in London is small, it was fine”
Reviews.Author: clive12_11
Reviews.Content: While I agree that the building was a maze and not having an elevator was a bummer, the location made up for it. We liked it. I was amazed at how small the bathroom was, but it worked. Breakfast was fine and the service was great. Very friendly. It was clean and it worked. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ok price for a just about average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ingerama
Reviews.Content: If it was all about location then the Royal Norfolk would be ideal for anyone wanting to be close to Paddington travel hub. We stayed here as we were off to a gig at Wembley where we could not get a room for love nor money. So travel wise great..... Price was OK as well for London Â£100 B&B for double room. Breakfast was suprisingly good and the staff were polite and the dining room was clean Right the room. The view was of internal walls but hey i didn't expect a riverside aspect. The room was small with just enough room for a double bed a a few drab dated bits of furniture. It was also dusty but the bed linen was clean as was the bathroom. The bathroom is a very tiny bolt on plastic affair but if you are after luxury you are not going to book in here anyhow. Heating was on full tilt and could not be turned down and could not leave window open as kitchen vent and smell was not too pleasant. If you just want somewhere to get your head down at a reasonable price with a decent breakfast then this is the place for you. If you are after a decent bathroom and some luxury then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: keedwell
Reviews.Content: although my single room was tiny it was well set out, clean and comfortable. great location, just minutes from paddington station. the lift hasnt worked for a year so it was really hard for myself and my aunt to get our luggage to and from our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “bedroom in a wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: 2lf
Reviews.Content: needs a total refurb our roms best described as bedroom in a wardrobe decor dull /drab had to carry case up loads of stairs.good breakfast.we booked this through superbreaks and it was pricey.in a word book somewhere else to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for London.”
Reviews.Author: annieanne7
Reviews.Content: I can never understand why people seem to think they are entitled to five star luxury when they have booked to stay in one of the least expensive hotels in town. We booked three twin rooms over the weekend (19th, 20th February) and enjoyed a comfortable, warm, clean stay in a good value hotel, located in very close proximity to Paddington station and tube. Reception staff were friendly, efficient and obliging and the complimentary left luggage facility proved very useful to us, both prior to checking in and after checking out. The breakfast was hearty and plentiful, whether we chose continental or full English (at no extra charge) and was served by friendly, efficient waitresses. This breakfast was better by far than many we have been served in much more expensive hotels. Granted, you could pick faults with the decor, but could I suggest that those who want marble and Egyptian cotton book into the Hilton hotel, literally just across the road, where they will pay seven times as much per person per night. Next time I want to stay in a well located budget hotel in central London, I wouldn't hesitate to book the Royal Norfolk.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel which needs a complete refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: exiledinfife
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nights last week, February 17th and 18th. The room was tiny, the ensuite was dirty and not fit for purpose and I found the reception staff unhelpful, and on one occasion verging on the hostile. When I arrived the man on reception was outside in the street and followed me into the hotel. He spoke broken English and was not able to give me accurate directions to my room. There were threadbare carpets in many areas. I was appalled to find that there were a large number of crumbs on the floor under the table where I had breakfast. The food was very poor in many respects. Some almost solid mushrooms with a very spicy taste. The bacon was not cooked properly and half the plate was covered with a very cheap brand of baked beans. I could go on but would just ask anyone reading this to think twice before booking here. There are literally dozens of hotels and guest houses in this area and they would struggle to be as bad as this place.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously......DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: Lee888_11
Reviews.Content: Shocking...Stayed in several travel lodges in my time, and they are half the price and 100% nicer. The room was tiny and dirty, much like the 'bathroom' and my room was well placed next to some sort of generator that was running all night making it impossible to sleep...don't think i'll be staying there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Henry025
Reviews.Content: Quite easily the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. We stayed at the hotel for one night as part of a theatre break. The hotel is in drastic need of refurbbishment, the decor is awful and there is a strange smell throughout. On arrival the receptionist took our name, gave us a key and then pointed to the stairs. It took us 10 minutes to find the room as the hotel is a maze. The Room Where do i start? Easily the worst room I have stayed in. It is tiny and only just big enough for a double bed. The carpet was filthy and the curtains were hanging off. The TV was easily 20 years old, had no remote and only channels 1-4. The window wouldnt shut properly so not only was there a draft, but we could hear all the noise from outside. The bed was lumpy and the sheets felt dirty. Now for the worst part, the bathroom. It was an absolute disgrace. It was filthy with mold all over the floor and walls. The shower curtain was disgusting and there was no hot water throughout our stay. The toilet wouldnt flush and there was a strong smell of sewage coming from it. I actually felt more dirty having used the bathroom, than i did before going in. The whole thing needs ripping out. The breakfast was poor, reheated sausage/ bacon and a few beans. Staff looked like they didnt want to be there. Overal an appauling hotel and the management should be embarassed at the prices they charge. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “stop moaning nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BEACHBABYWithamEssex
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night as a package to see jersey boys. Very easy to find hotel just opposite paddington undreground. Royal Norfolk was clean warm and the staff were lovely. We had full english breakfast itwas lovely and the wairess treated us as if we were 5 starr. Well done Royal Norfolk we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Hazel068
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for one night and it was the worst night we've ever had. The hotel itself desperatley needs refurbishing throughout, the room we stayed in was not very clean there was no hot water,The curtains were moth eaten and dirty, the noise outside was terrible all night we never slept at all.Then we were hoping that perhaps the breakfast would make up for our lousy night but we were wrong, we sat down at a table and we had a hoice between a full english or continental breakfast, my husband had the full english which was not very nice the bacon was not cooked properly, I had the continental which were fake corn flakes a yoghurt that at least was a muller light then a plate of ham and cheese slices that must of been out of the pound shop

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, unless you are a snob...”
Reviews.Author: JonKipling
Reviews.Content: Reading complaints here I expected the worst. As with a large portion of London, the hotel is very old. Don't expect air conditioning, or large rooms. As a tourist, a large room is the last thing that I needed. The room was for sleeping. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean, and there was little wait time for breakfast. It was loud on Friday/Saturday night (it was during the world cup so there was plenty of partying). I brought earplugs, problem solved. I gave this hotel a high rating to try to balance it out, there are way too many reviews trashing this place. The price compared to other central London hotels was great.. The location is great, and really, the hotel is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Once is enough!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveHig
Reviews.Content: Like others, I partly booked this hotel on its location, which is less than 50m from the underground. However this had one unexpected result in that even on the 4th floor you could hear the rumblings of the underground trains. We arrived late and I was immediately concerned when seeing that our room number had been changed on the receptionist's list, and another number penciled in. Had someone complained? This is a warren of a hotel with many floors but no lift or porter service. The room was the smallest I have ever stayed in and care was needed when two people were getting dressed! A double bed was pushed against the wall on one side of the room. The Toilet/shower room were in keeping with the room also being incredibly small, the shower did not drain, but extra towels were available to put on the floor! When I said to the receptionist that this was a terrible room, he agreed! - but did not offer to move us. I will however say that the bed was reasonably comfortable and the bedding was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Patty29223
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 2 december till 7 december, and we think itÂ´s a fair acommodation for the price we payed. The room and the bathroom are very small, but nothingÂ´s missing! The bed is confortable and the room ir warm for the temperatures we felt in London. The hotel is near almost everything, and the London tube is across the road. The breakfast is ok too. If you want something more luxurious, the Hilton is across the street, but you wonÂ´t pay 65Â£ a day!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hilextra
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel very conveniently located for Paddington station and it is cheap. Good points: staff were friendly when we checked in and at breakfast; sheets were clean and room generally clean and tidy. Bad points: Couldn't even find the lift to our third floor room, but only had an overnight bag so could manage stairs. But not for those with heavy luggage or any sort of disability. No double-glazing on rattly old sash windows meant our room fronting the road was noisy. No shower curtain or panel on both so floor gets wet when you shower and it's not very pleasant. Bathroom needed complete modernisation. Breakfast pretty awful. Cheap and nasty products (unlabelled tea-bags, jam etc which means they are as cheap as you can get). This was OK for one night as somewhere to sleep, but I would not go back and would not like to have spent longer there. Yes, the Hilton across the road looks a lot more attractive and I would pay more for the extra comfort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere... SERIOUSLY!”
Reviews.Author: magicmand
Reviews.Content: After the travel agent showed myself and my friend pictures of this hotel we thought it looked brilliant and on the day, after all the travelling we were delighted to see how close it was to paddington station. However the smiles were soon wiped off our faces when we stepped in the door. We were informed the lift upstairs was broken and had to haul our large suitcases up the very poorly signed stairs to our room. Seriously, we couldn't even fit our suitcases in and still walk around. The room was tiny, the lights were dismal and coated in dust, the bathroom was like an all in one cupboard with no bath, just a shower, sink and toilet all together. The window vent was broken and jammed open, meaning the room was like a fridge. Oh and the bed had no covers on the quilts. I immediately went back to the front desk to complain and, thankfully, they gave us another room, this time a decent size with a proper bath in the seperate bathroom. Unfortunately this meant hauling our belongings up two more flights of stairs! Over our 5 night stay we only had breakfast in the hotel once as it really left a lot to be desired. It wasn't particularly unpleasant, just the staff seemed irritable and we felt rather uncomfortable. Luckily there was a number of food chains in the same street so we didn't starve. The few good points in the room ended at the TV which had some freeview channels, but no remote, a CD player/radio, and a large radiator which did keep us reasonably warm. Bad points however; no shower curtain or any kind of enclosure around the bath meant the floor flooded everytime wanted a shower. Everything we touched seemed to fall apart, from the top of the hot tap coming loose, to the knob on the warbrobe coming off in my hand as i tried to open it. The room seemed generally clean, although I tried not to look to closely after the first room, and regularly used hand sanitizer whilst staying there. The staff were often very short with us and although our beds were made at some point everyday, they failed to empty our bins, fill up our tea and milk and even failed to provide us with toilet roll! The last day though really took the biscuit. Sitting in our room, packing, with the door locked and the key in the door, with the tv on (so its not like the room was silent) a member of staff unlocked the door, pushing out our key, walked in, without knocking and upon seeing us asked if we'd like the room cleaned! We told them to leave, appalled at the fact they'd just walked in when anything could have been going on! In all my life I've never known such poor service! The only thing that saved them was the fact they had actually moved our rooms without any hassle and the only polite member of staff we encountered carried our suitcases down the last flight of stairs after two others had watched us struggling. With a view of the Hilton mocking us out of our window, my friend and I both agreed the hotel was an absolute joke. If the room we were switched to is the same price as the one we'd been originally put in I think its an absolute disgrace that people pay good money for such a terrible room! Seriously, stay elsewhere if you want a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Its Ok for a couple of nights....................”
Reviews.Author: lordburnside
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Good points - Its handy for paddington underground (50 metres). It is next to a Scotch Steak House and near an Aberdeen Steakhouse and a Garfunkels amongst others. Pub up the road called Fountains Abbey typical London pub. The room was small but the bed comfortable. The shower was tiny but worked ok. The toilet shower and washbasin took up one square metre! The room was as long as the bed but the bed was comfortable. Its ok for a couple of night and cost Â£65 a night. Breakfast was adequate. Full English is one rasher of bacon, 4 mushroom, a fries egg, beans and 4 half slices of bread. Tea or coffee or fruit juice. It was OK. The only problem was that you had to queue to get into breakfast if you hit the rush hour period. Staff are of course from abroad and so tend to seem unfriendly but possibly cannot speak our language well.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I have of stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: SharonTweedHeads
Reviews.Content: The hotels layout was a maze. There was no porter service. You had to drag your bags up, down and around corridors to your room. There was no guidance on how to get to your room. I did not hear or see one Englishman/woman during our stay. The check in clerk, breakfast staff, housekeeping were all foreigners. The breakfast staff were rude and abrupt. Our room was on a slant so the blood rushed to our head when in bed. The room was hot so we had to sleep with the window open but there was an incredible amount of street noise. The only thing going for the hotel is its location but even then I wouldn't consider staying here again. It's highly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in a 1940s Black & White Movie”
Reviews.Author: Kiki1950
Reviews.Content: While in the UK, we went to a travel agent and asked for assistance for a round-trip plane shuttle as well as a hotel to London for one overnight to visit family in the area. We described the quality of the hotel we wanted by saying that it should be something along the lines of a Holiday Inn-type. Not anything five star, but somewhere in the middle, clean, and near to Paddington Train Station. Well, be still my heart! What we ended up with was an abomination! The only way it resembled our criteria was by being in close proximity to the train station. It reminded me of some place out of the1940s where a WW II soldier would have taken a woman for a one-nighter. The lobby was nothing more than a store front, of sorts, with a front desk area at the foot of - at some point in time long, long ago - a beautiful staircase. The carpeting was stretched and buckled causing a walking hazard, and the public loo on the first floor was the typical old style hole in the floor; of which we had no appreciation for. Althoough by now we might have enjoyed a glass of wine, we chose not to try to relax in the very dark and dreary bar down the hall behind the front desk. The musty smelling halls and rooms were what one would expect to see in an old black and white movie showing an old boarding house. But let's start with the key. A basic skeleton key in 2010!? That should have been one of the first clues as to what lay ahead. And then there was the bathrooom! Oh dear God - the bathroom! It was actually a fiberglass shower enclosure installed / recessed into a wall with a shower curtain running across it providing just enough room for one to take a shower. The toilet, toilet paper holder, sink and mirror were also inside the same enclosure! The genius who installed the toilet paper holder in that spot obviously didn't take into consideration that the roll would get wet from the shower water! There was a set of recessed shelves that appeared to have been a closet in it's former life, but now housed an older "boom-box" radio CD/ tape player and a tube-type TV with a choice of four channels. A hair dryer was mounted on the wall right next to the door and was too high for me to reach. The sheets and blankets were old and showed signs of wear. The place was "tidy" but I can't categorize it as being "clean". Again, it had an old, musty house smell to it everywhere (probably because it actually hadn't had a thorough cleaning since WW II). We were so tired when we arrived - and at that point, when we finally finished climbing the stairs (no working elevator/ lift) and walking the length of the building to the room - that we just didn't have enough energy to check out and go look for someplace more livable and not so depressing. So, I lay motionless and awake most of the night, staring at the ceiling waiting for some drunkard to mistake the room for his own, and burst through the door using his own skeleton key! They did serve breakfast. It's served in a room on the second floor that looks somewhat like a sort of tea room. We opted not. In fact, we couldn't wait for dawn to come, and when it did - we RAN out of that place. It's been a couple of months now and we can finally laugh a good belly laugh when recalling that hotel. However, at a point when we were travelling and tired and in unfamiliar territory, it certainly failed to be entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “Another Shocking Rubbish London Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mi0kwd
Reviews.Content: Where can i start with this place!! I work in london alot and have nightmares finding decent hotels at a decent price, when i found this place i was pleased with the price and location so booked away. When i arrived the reception wasnt upto much but i thought give it a chance. Our room was on the 4th floor and there was no lift, im no old fart but this was hard work with a case up tiny maze of staircases. On the way up i noticed a few bad signs, filthy nets up windows and dirty marked walls. When i finally got to the room i opened the door and nearly fell in the shower the room was so small, the room was just big enough to fit two single beds and for some reason in the corner of the room they had crammed some sort of pre-fab plastic bathroom which to be honest was disgusting. Who ever dreamt this idea up to put this in must have been quite drunk at the time. The bathroom was musty smelling and you could hardly fit in it, the shower was a waste of time with just a trickle of water. I felt dirtier after i got out of the shower trying to dodge the smelly stained shower curtain. I was tempted to spend the night in the van after this. All in all this place is a dive and should be forced into a refurb. There are many hotels in london that need the same treatment, its not like they cant afford it at the prices they charge! The problem is that the usual reliable chain hotels charge ridiculous amounts in the city which leaves these independant rot holes to charge what they like and it doesn't help when people stay there and write a review saying it was ok, it did the job. Everyones got different standards but come on what are these peoples used to if they think a place like this is ok. Outside of london this place would be lucky to be able to charge Â£20 per night and that would be pushing it!

Reviews.Title: “I regret having chosen this hotel - but it was only for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan_Rio
Reviews.Content: I was given a really bad room - nopisy (nest to some constsnt air-conditoning vent), musty and over-heated (the heating couln't be turned down and the window didn't open adeuqately). The toilet wouldn't flush but I was told by the (very friendly) member of staff that it was "OK" and that I just needed to wait some time (i.e. 20 minutes) for the tank to fill up and then try again........Breakfast was good and I did find the staff to be freindly and helpful but I would not chose to stay at this hotel again as you can get far-better last minute deals

Reviews.Title: “Never complain why you sent at the Royal norfolk!”
Reviews.Author: jamesjames103
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, unless you have a complaint. They are not interested and are extremely rude when you mention something is not right. There is still no lift and I asked to be on a lower floor, as I have a bad knee, but was placed on the third floor. Only book, if you cant find somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: juice-trip
Reviews.Content: Oke, the Royal Norfolk is not the most posh hotel to stay. But it's cheep and cheerful. Our two person room was not enormous but big enough. A great bed, fresh towels, a clean room every day and a decent bathroom with bath. There was a small tv in the room (that we didn't used), a hairdryer, our own coffee/tea-maker and - also - a small stereoset. Oke, here and there the place could be updated, but personally I don't care if the carpets on the stairs are a bit stained or 'overaged'. Or if the curtains in the room are not my style. Come on, I just shower and sleep in the place. The service was professional and nice. As well in the reception area as in the breakfastroom. And the breakfast was more then enough. Coffee an tea as much as you wanted, orange juice, muesli, yoghurt, toast, different marmelades, cheese and ham (free continental) or a full English for just two pounds extra. Sometimes you had to wait to be seated, because every table was occupied Mostly I didn't waited to long but went to the other side of the street to have a drink and a small (cheap) breakfast on the terrace of sandwichshop Litttle Bite. The Norfolk is perfectly situated at Paddington Station and the underground. Also, in the evening, there are lot of nice places to eat and drink. The Saywers Arms, opposite the road, is fun for a drink and/or a bite, the small Italian San Marco serves great pizza's for a ridiculous low price, the Indian place Mughal hasn't a good reputation for service but the food is super. A bit further away (a 20 minutes walk, at Porcherters Gardens) you'll find the Cous Cous Cafe. Bit more expensive but an excellent and cozy Maroccan. The closeby Victoria is an absolute beautiful English pub, etc., etc. Around the hotel you'll will also find a lot of Libanese cafe' and restaurants, especially on Edgware Road. And if you walk to Little Venice (just around one of the corners of Paddington Station and London Street) you'll enter a little paradise with beautiful narrowboats on the canals and a couple of more trendy stylisch restaurants at the waterside. Also Notting Hill (one undergroundstop or a relaxed walk that takes about 25/30 minutes) had lot of great options to spend a nice day/evening. And Hyde Park is just around the corner also. But back to the hotel. Yes, the lift are -probably- forever out of work. So I wouldn't go there if you have a problem with climbing stairs. Further I can't find any excuse of not going there. it's not the Hilton but a small budget place. Excellent is you just have to shower and sleep there. And certainly not the 'hotel from hell' as some guests call it. I wiil happily return there.

Reviews.Title: “nothing royal about this place”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: myself with my three cousins one had had a knee replacement a few months ago I have had three hip replacements. I asked before we booked about a lift we were told yes. when we arrived we had to leave our cases in a small cuboard they just gave us the keys and there was a door through to a pub so if you wanted to steel cases you could just walk out. we all had to use the toilets there was a gents next to the cuboard and a ladies at the other side. they were disgusting and smelt a sign said they were checked every hour ( this must have been in the war !!.) then at 2pm we returned to get in to our rooms. they handed us our keys and told us to walk up to the 4th floor. it was on the lift door it said the lift was out of order by the look of the sign it must have been out of order for many years. when we managed to get to the top floor my single room was across a bridge to the top of another building. the room was so small I could not streach my legs out of the bed. the toilet looked as if it used to be in a caravan pink plastic the shower was so slow and hardly any power water would over flow on to the tiles it was so small you could just turn in no more!! But the beds were very good and clean breakfast was ok nothing special. but the persons serving were very dour and just asked what you wanted and that was it. I complained about my room so the moved me two doors down it was not much bigger and the toilet was just as small. I except its a budget hotel but when I complained to the manager Jabcob Szendera he said where did i get the information about having a lift as they dont advertise it on the web site I asked about it when I called and he went on that 90% of paddington hotels dont have lifts! as for the toilets in the lobby they dont belong to the hotel but are owned by the pub next door ( there are no signs telling guests this!) I would warn anybody going to London dont stay here its disgusting and very run down the carpet in the front lobby is dirty and all pulled up when you look on the web site beleve me it in no way resembles what you get !!!!

Reviews.Title: “How does this hotel get away with it?”
Reviews.Author: BeansSouthWest_uk
Reviews.Content: My wife, step-son and I stayed at the Norfolk last night. One twin room and one single room. Booked last week as accommodation while we went to watch a show in the West End and enjoyed a day shopping. We parked at Paddington Station's car park ( Not bad value at Â£22 for 24 hours) about 10 mins walk from hotel- just turned up and parked unbooked. The hotel's location is very good- a few hundred yards from Paddington Tube- 20 mins or so to Covent Garden. We arrived too early to check in but were able to lock our bags in a cupboard on the ground floor while we went out. The hotel is very down-at-heel. The entrance is very dated and a little grubby. Our rooms were on third floor (twin) and fourth floor (single). The lift was out of action and, looking at the age-worn out of order notice and reading other reviews, it has been in the same condition for many years. Thus we had to walk up many flights of grubby stairs and wend our way through sepentine corridors carrying our bags to get to our rooms. The rooms are grim- very old decor, nasty curtains, filthy faux suede bed heads, the cheapest, nastiest furniture. These features wierdly juxtaposed with very clean bed linen and comfortable beds! The en-suite bathroom is a tiny wet room which looks as though it has been recently ripped out of an ancient caravan. There is a toilet, a basin and a shower- none seemed too clean and the floor is revolting. Water was hot though. A genuinely unpleasant experience to use. The breakfast room is reasonably pleasant, the service reasonable and the food offering is fine. My wife had the Â£2 upgrade to full English which she enjoyed. My step-son and I had the continental- Ham and processed cheese, toast (which seemed to be unlimited in quantity), cheap, but decent jams and butter, coffee and yoghurt- all pretty good. I stay in expensive, business hotels several times a week all around the country so I am being careful not to demand too much from an economy hotel, however I can scarcely believe the poor standards, poor decoration and downright unpleasantness of the rooms this hotel offers. ( My step-son's room was little more than a grubby cupboard). The thought of American or other international visitors seeing this as a typical British hotel is horrifying. Strangely the hotel's failings did not ruin our brief city break we had a brilliant time. I cannot imagine that we are unique in saying that we will never return to this hotel - it seems inconceivable that anyone would stay at the Norfolk more than once.- this is a great pity as relatively small level of investment and time;cleaning and updating the rooms in combination with it's excellent location would make this an ideal hotel. It seems that while the owners can get away it they do. Despite the cheap price - as my school reports used to say "Could do better"

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Bad service”
Reviews.Author: pokekyo
Reviews.Content: Check in - The hotel looked outdated from the outside but as we had walked an hour and a half from Victoria Station we would have happily sat down on a front door step! We checked in with good spirits and the reception staff member was quiet and playing on his phone. We took the key after the regular procedures and went to the room to inspect. The room - The room was small, which we expected as it was a budget break and the tv was very old fashioned and dusty. We had a kettle with coffee and tea etc. The bed was very comfortable and clean with blankets at the bottom of the wardrobe in case we were cold. There was no air con and no way of opening our window, the window was also cracked and the view from outside was a storeroom with wooden boards taped on the windows with duct tape. The bathroom was 2 steps down and didnt look as though it had beed properly cleaned in a while, the lino flooring had several large cracks with black swollen wood bulging out (swollen from leaking shower). The shower was very small and again black grime in between the tiles and cracks everywhere. The toilet looked cleanish but I didn't get too close and the sink and mirror had been wiped. Breakfast - Continental breakfast was included free of charge and to get Full English (which consisted of 1 egg, toast, 1 sausage, 1 slice of bacon with tomatoes and mushrooms) you could pay Â£2.00 per person extra. I was happy with the continental breakfast and after seeing what others had been given I wouldn't have paid the extra. We were given 1.5 slices of toast, 2 slices of ham, 2 cheese slices 1 yoghurt and a bowl of corn flakes or museli and unlimited juice/tea/filter coffee, which was plenty! We asked for extra toast and were given another 3 slices between us.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: bevbutterfly
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed uncared for with minimum effort to improve.. Lift was not working. Problems with en-suite due to two narrow steps to enter, lack of space, fresh air and over mirror light worked intermittently. Shower was a joke as controls worked opposite to instruction. Shower cubicle was too shallow so water flooded into toilet area. Unpleasant smell. The bedroom was not of the same quality as pictured on the website. From the site there was no indication that you had to pay Â£2 extra for full English Breakfast. The overall impression was that everything was dumbed down to a price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ChaelaH
Reviews.Content: This is meant to be a 3* hotel, however it barely scrapes a 2 in my opinion. Initial impressions as we entered the building were that the hotel was shabby & in bad need of a makeover. The reception area carpet is so wrinkled, my wheeled case got stuck on one of them. We were told by a gruff young lady that our room was not ready & given a key & directions to the luggage store. I used the bathroom which was really grubby. When we returned after an hour, we were given the key to our room, on the 4th floor & told that the lift was out of order. I asked for someone to take our luggage up for us, this did happen, but they didn't seem happy to do it. The hotel building was probably once lovely but is now grubby and in desperate need of a refit. The bedroom was adequate for our needs, but had no space to store our cases. The bathroom was a joke!! Our caravan bathroom is bigger, It was really awkward to get into, up 2 very narrow steps & totally airless with the door shut. The shower was minute & very loose, it refused to stay upright once the water was turned on. Both evenings were very warm & we had to sleep with the window open, but noise of traffic & other guests kept us awake both nights. Which was a shame as the beds were actually quite comfy. The breakfast was terrible!! The staff were rude & spoke very little English which made communication difficult. We opted for the continental breakfast which consisted of museli, - we had to ask twice for the milk, yoghurt - no choice, toast & jam, cheese - sliced burger type, ham & orange juice - which we left because it tasted odd, coffee & tea - which we had to ask for twice because they forgot. All the food came at the same time & there was not enough space to put it all. We both felt as if we were in a boarding school!! We left our cases in the luggage cupboard again after checkout & were again just given the key. There was absolutely NO! security & had we been dishonest, there would have been more than enough opportunity to go through other peoples belongings. We visit London regularly on 'girlie' weekends & have stayed in much better hotels than this for less money. NEVER AGAIN!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: eden66186394
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Superbreaks for a weekend in London. The hotel is quite shabby and badly in need of a serious upgrade. Our double room was tiny and very claustrophobic. There is no air conditioning and we happened to stay on the hottest weekend of the year so far. As a result we had to leave the window open overnight and as the room faced onto the street, it was very noisy. The ensuite shower room was nothing more than an alcove off the bedroom with a sliding door. Water in the shower tray would not drain away and the shower was not very clean. Toilet also made strange noises when flushed. There was no TV remote control and no tea/coffee making facilities. On a positive note we did find the staff friendly and helpful and the hotel was very convenient for travelling by underground (only a hundred yards from Paddington. We would avoid this hotel in future!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: anth1988
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 3 nights last week whilst on our break in London. I previously wrote a review on this hotel about my stay 2 years ago, the hotel was good value then, but even better now. The price is brilliant considering you are in the centre of London. The only things I can fault is the cooked breakfast is not very nice (It's free), but there is cereal available with plenty of toast and conserves and unlimited tea/coffee/orange juice which is very very good. The rooms are quite small generally, but we were lucky enough to get one of the Duke of Wellington suites which was a bigger room with pine furniture. Noise outside from nearby pubs was quite loud but this was only down to the World Cup being on, it's not normally like this. I've read some reviews from other people who did nothing but complain about this hotel. Yes the rooms and bathroom are small and it could do with a refurb but, the price reflects this. A hotel, for most people on city breaks, is a base (Somewhere to sleep), not to spend the majority of their break in. Overall the staff were friendly, a locked cupboard is available for storing luggage before room is ready and after checking out. Maids came and cleaned thr room, changed bed sheets and renewed towels everyday. Transport links a brilliant with Paddington Station having national rail and the main tube lines running through it. Also there is a tour bus available which takes you around the main attractions around London. This is the second time I've stayed here and it certainly won't be the last. The hotel also offers a discounted price on tickets into Londons attractions which can be purchased from reception. This saves you money and it means you don't have to queue at the attraction!!!. I would definately recomment this hotel to anyone wishing to find reasonably priced Central London accomodation with quick transport links to various london hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “"no frills"”
Reviews.Author: HLL44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very easy to locate with it being being a stones throw from Paddington station. We arrived at the hotel 2hrs ahead of schedule and were allowed to put our bag in a small hall cupboard and asked to come back at 2pm. Our room was clean and a reasonable size however it is a very basic hotel all together,. The carpets on the stairs and landings are thread bear in many areas. The lift was out of order whilst we were there and some American travelers were complaining about this as they had previously stayed there and the lift was still out of use. The breakfast was 'ok' but nothing special. If u are looking for a clean basic hotel that is very close to Paddington and the attractions in that area then use the Royal Norfolk as a base.

Reviews.Title: “SMALL, NOT A VERY NICE HOTEL AT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: flower1919
Reviews.Content: I had booked a twin room for my friend and I but we were given a double on 2nd floor, went and complained, girl on desk helpful...but gave us a twin on guess what... 4th floor...lift not working, it was soooo small and pokey looked out onto a wall and window of the hotel. The shower room... well, had better and bigger in caravans.. the shower was not working had to hold it, and the plastic (non to clean) curtain stuck to you...awful bathroom. beds comfy and clean. Brakfast is bad as well, 1 gloopy egg, 3 tiny mushrooms 1 slice of bacon 2 of the smallest sausages I have ever seen and reheated about 6 times beans yuk ! we paid Â£160 for this room as we booked through a company that did tickets as well but thats what the cost was after the tickets...what a rip off..

Reviews.Title: “Don't try this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rajneesh14
Reviews.Content: we stayed there from 10 to 13 May 10. 1. Lift not working.. and its 4 stored. 2.A bald guy on night shift extremely rude,un cooperative.. 3.Dirthy bathrooms. Enough reasons for not staying.There r many good hotels near by much better at same price.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: JanBostonMa
Reviews.Content: No elevator ! Was put on the fourth floor, no bell boy had to haul my luggage up four flights. Key would not fit in lock (twice). Only one person at desk so no one can assist you in any way ! Ended up checking out could not even stay for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous - avoid at all costs !”
Reviews.Author: GravitymanCornwall
Reviews.Content: My booking was through "Superbreak" with overnight stays ahead of and after an international trip to Turkey. The outward stay was bad enough, with a room so small the door would not fully open, and I banged my head on the shower cubicle - which was really only suitable for dog grooming ! On my return stay (tired and extremelly late arrival from Turkey, after all day travelling ), I was advised by receoption that the room was "larger this time , and with a double bed" However opening the door of the room and switching on the light - I was almost physiaclly sick to find the room bed had been slept in, and rubbish bags were still in the room !!!! - Yuck !. Complaints led me to the only room left in the hotel - smaller than my outward stay room!. Panic calls to room service - had the original cleaned and tidied, and I returned to it by midnight, for some attempted sleep. I would never stay here again - a better solution would be cardboard boxes in a doorway.!

Reviews.Title: “May I suggest you think again?”
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel, unless you have no other options. The best thing that can be said about this place is that you get what you pay for - because you pay very little. The room I was given was up multiple flights of stairs (no lift). it was small, it was cramped, and it was dirty. I am not the best person in the world when it comes to cleaning my bathroom at home, but I expect a bit more when I stay at a hotel. The hotel's prime selling point seems to be its proximity to Paddington railway station (and hence Heathrow Airport). However, if you do not know, Paddington Station is not the nicest part of London (particularly at night). I would strongly recommend paying a bit more, or moving further out of the city centre if you want a decent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - no more!”
Reviews.Author: veronica11
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I booked before reading the reviews. When we arrived were allocated a room on the 4th floor- were not advised that the lift was not working and struggled with case up the very old staircase. The bathroom was very dated with dirty taps etc. but the sheets and very small towels were clean. Full English breakfast was virtually inedible and there was difinately not service with a smile. You get what you pay for a room in London for the night and a meal but value for money it is not nor is it an experience I wish to repeat

Reviews.Title: “nothing royal”
Reviews.Author: joy_jefferson
Reviews.Content: was on third floor lift broken clean no towels left one day carpets threadbear throughout staff not interested breakfast very basic no ceral on offer with full english will not go back

Reviews.Title: “We found the hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: joyfulNorfolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very much in need of refurbishment. Carpets throughout were threadbare and the place did not seem clean. Our room was on the 3rd floor and as there was no lift it was a challenge.The room was tiny and we had a back of hotel room,which did not even have a view.The window was opaque and broken.When we managed to get it open the outside was disgusting and covered in pigeon droppings. The bathroom was like a cupboard and very claustrophobic.My partner is not very mobile and could not use the shower as he could not turn round in it! The curtain wraps itself round you and is in the way. The staff were offhand and not very welcoming,breakfast was ok but basic. We shold have read the reviews first!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, dirty, depressing!”
Reviews.Author: pickledonion
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night and requested 2 rooms on the same floor as we had 2 children, 2 months before we arrived. The rooms were 3 floors apart, no help or assistance given when we arrived. The carpets are threadbare and dirty, the curtains the same. The en-suite was mouldy, small, dirty and no hot water. During the night our door was banged upon with people trying to get in. We ended up having all 4 of us in one room, sleeping on towels and leaving at 6am just to get out of there. DO NOT STAY HERE, awful.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points.”
Reviews.Author: SouterJohn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 8 to 12 December on a bargain break through Superbreaks. I had booked before checking the hotel out on Tripadvisor and on finally checking it out was a little apprehensive on reading some reviews. I have to agree that it looks run down with areas of threadbare carpeting but I never came across anything that I considered 'dirty' . In fact I saw staff cleaning the public areas at various times during the day and evening. The room and shower/toilet were small but clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and efficient and the breakfast was very good,offering a choice of english or continental. The hotel was idealy sited for us next to Paddington Rail and Tube stations and within easy walking distance of Oxford Street and Kensington As I said I got a bargain break but I would not pay full price until the hotel was upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: arsenalchris1978
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on lastminute.com and have stayed there about 8 times in the last 3 years for city breaks or a place to stay when I go to watch football in London. The hotel is a little warn and reminds me of an old style Blackpool B&B, however is may have a few cracked walls and warn carpets but I have always found it exception value, helpful staff and a nice breakfast, some of the rooms can be a little small with tiny shower rooms but hey when your in London you dont got to sit in your room all day do ya!, As I have already said Ive been to this hotel 8 times and have already booked for new year. The Location is perfect, directly accross from Paddington Mainline Station and tube station, the circle, district and bakerlook lines all stop here so connecting with any part of London is easy, there are also 2 great pubs on within 2 second walk of the hotel serving nice food and there is every possible fast food restaurant within 2 minutes walk. All in all I find this hotel perfect for a clean, warm place to stay when visiting and exploring London, its not perfect but the price reflects that. I had previously stayed with travel lodge in London and ths hotel beats them hands down for value...Cant wait to visit again

Reviews.Title: “should have trip advised it first”
Reviews.Author: dixi2
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights at the Royal Norfolk Hotel in Paddington, Great location but unfortunately the Hotel lacks quality in an abundance and needs alot of money for a drastic refurb. The carpets are mainly thread bare throughout and are of a very poor quality. Our room was on the 3rd floor even though we had requested ground or first floor. The room was poorl, tatty fittings no tv remote, There was not a suitable table or area to boil a kettle which was dangerous someone could scold themselves if not careful. The window wouldnt close properly, the curtains are damp, the shower was in only what i can describe as a walk in wardrobe and the toilet well, it would flush only with an effort, and it seemed to make funny noises as well as smells all by its self. When in the shower it was so old the controls are not readable it worked but just We asked the next morning to be moved we looked at a room on the 2nd floor at the back of the hotel well it was awful so we went back to our original room The breakfast was ok but why are mushrooms cooked in garlic at breakfast ? And orange juice is more like squash generally not wonderful We had arranged to pick our luggage up later on departure,The cases are kept in a locked cupboard ground floor, On our return we both used the toilets downstairs they were an absolute disgrace 100% filth we have never seen toilets like this before. How can they be left to get in this state what are the managers doing. This was my last image off leaving this Hotel .Never to return

Reviews.Title: “check the toilets first!!!”
Reviews.Author: josiefromholland
Reviews.Content: Although we've been to London many times, we never had a hotel with toilets as dirty as the Royal Norfolk hotel. Our room was nice and clean, shower was ok. But when we checked out i had to go to the toilet one last time. I was sent to the toilets at the Hotel lobby. Check for yourself how they looked when i got there!!!! We were also told there was a full English breakfast served, but when we asked for it they made us pay for it. We were told, the English breakfast wasn't included with the room we had!

Reviews.Title: “If your not fussy, it's not bad”
Reviews.Author: derby03
Reviews.Content: We rented two rooms, one for us and one for my husband's folks. We paid 65.00 pounds a night. Not bad considering other hotels were charging 135 pounds that were not much better with no breakfast. Location was great, breakfast was ok for being included. Our room was quite spacious with King Size bed and full bath. It was rm 131. The other room was very small though. The hotel looked shabby, and needs a bit of fixing, but we found it really clean. They cleaned everyday. the hotel staff was friendly but didn't speak alot of English we found. Location was great with the underground so close. If you are used to the size of European rooms in places like central London, and your not expecting the same standards of a US hotel for the price, then I would recommend this hotel as I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, Bed Mites”
Reviews.Author: Mariaroza
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this 'hotel' for 4 nights. As regards to location great but the buck stops there. The room 232 was on the second floor with no lift. It was small, the carpets pityful and the 'en-suite' shower was a joke. A broom cupboard. The sheets were never changed and everday dots of blood appeared on the sheets. When my husband and I arrived home both our bodies were covered with mites bites. Been to the doctor and after 8 days we are still suffering the consequences. Lotions, antibiotics and lice treatments. WHAT A SHAME. HYGIENE NON EXISTANT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “small, not pretty but cheap and a very convevient location”
Reviews.Author: aussiedude121
Reviews.Content: This hotel has tiny bedrooms and an even smaller bathroom but for a negotiated 65 Pounds per night it is good value, and bedding is clean - don't expect 5 star for that price. Continental breakfast is the same as you find at most Europe hotels and is included in the price. Yes the lift doesn't work so when we went back to stay for the 2nd time we only booked again if they would give us a 1st Floor room - no higher floor than that, and that was what we got. (1st trip we got the 3rd floor room and I wouldn't go back if I had to walk all that winding stairway again ) The location is right across the road from Paddington station and walking to Hyde Park & beyond was easy. Hop on hop off bus stops at their front door. So if you only want somewhere to sleep at night it's good value, but if you want to spend time in the room during the day, maybe look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrendous hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: purdysmokey
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at this so called 3 star hotel after a 2.5 hour train journey,we were informed that our room was on the 3rd floor and that the lift was out of order( we have since discovered that it has been like this for at least 6 months).There was no offer of assistance with our luggage and we therefore had to struggle up 6 flights of dangerous stairs which had badly worn carpet and no grippers in places.Each flight of stairs held its own terror.bearing in mind we had no idea where we were going.Through a door which opened towards you,not easy when carrying luggage.We eventually made it to our room where it took 5 minutes to open the door due to the lock being faulty. When we entered the room it looked nothing like any room in theyre advertisments.part of it hadnt even finished being painted.the en-suite (HA HA) was just about big enough to stand in.The bath looked like it had never seen Cif or Cilit bang.The sink had a large chunk which had been broken off and glued back in,the lavatory flushed on occassion,and if you had a bath and turned on the hot tap it was almost impossible to turn it off again.The carpet in the bedroom was as badly fitted as the stairs and to this moment we are not sure if it was supposed to be blue or black as it was so dirty.The T.V with 15 freeveiw channels was an old set with no remote and only 5 channels all of which were in green as the colour tube had gone.Although we were across from other buildings we could not close the curtains due to a fault on the rail.The windows which were old sash windows rattled and the whole sleeping experience was almost non existant due to the second world war mattress which we had to sleep on.All in all one of the most terrible hotels we have ever stayed in and we would urge anyone wanting a pleasant break in London to avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: pixie04
Reviews.Content: shabby, noisy, horrible carpets, small rooms, you can hardly move in them. Horrible bath room with very noisy ventilator. Everything is in need of renovation! Breakfast was terrible: white toast with depressing jam and melt cheese, you put inside a hamburger bun.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok for what we paid for but won't be staying there again!”
Reviews.Author: wenhelall
Reviews.Content: Good points: Location, price and good travel links and the breakfast in the morning. Bad points: The staff seemed not interested at all we were lucky to get 2 words out of them, the room was very outdated and needed moderising, the bathroom itself was clean but grotty, the enamel coming of the bath, no shower screen and dampness all over the place. Also the locks on the door were far from secure. I am a small girl and I am sure with a hard enough push the door would have broken open! It satisfied our needs for our time in London but I will be choosing a different hotel the next time I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: lou91
