Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing special but if you are looking for somewhere to stay for a couple of days in London and are only looking for a hotel to leave your bags at and bed for the night then this hotel woud be fine! The location of the hotel is excellent, just across the road from paddington station! The hotel was abit shabby but the room I stayed in was clean so I was happy enough! If you want a cheap stay in London and dont expect too much this hotel will be for you!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrendous - never again!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CarbarBristol
Reviews.Content: How can this be a 3* hotel? The whole place needs refurbishing. The carpets are threadbare, the single rooms we had were exceptionally small and the shower/toilet room too small for comfort.. When we asked how we could get some hot water in the shower we were told to run the tap on the wash basin for ten minutes first because the boiler was in the basement! The lift did not work and my friend was on the 4th floor. The bed linen and towels were clean and the staff friendly and helpful - we felt sorry for the staff having to work under such awful conditions! My friend and I spent as little time as possible in the hotel as we could not tolerate it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: bllma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights at the beginning of March. During the entire time we were there the elevator was broken and we saw no signs that they were attempting to fix it. We had 2 rooms and asked to be on the same floor. While we were assured we were, to reach one room from the other you had to go out on the roof and cross a bridge (ie. fire escape) While overall the hotel was clean it certainly could stand to have some upgrades to such things as the carpets. The bathroom, what appeared to be module units stuck in the rooms as an after-thought, was barely big enough to accommodate one person. While I would like to say that the location next to Paddington Station was a positive unless you are on the street side of the hotel you will hear and feel the trains. Even if I was only going to stay one night for the convenience of trains I would think twice about stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel - Central Location”
Reviews.Author: claudio_climb
Reviews.Content: Standard english old style hotel. Good location, near paddinton tube station. No lift, rooms are small and furnishings are old. Basin without. mixer tap. Bed sheets are stained. just enough quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Book this Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: wispSwansea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed for Paddington but that is all it has going for it. It was shabby. The room was very small and the en suite was a cupboard . The lift was broken so we had to carry our cases up 3 flights of stairs .Yes it was cheap but in future we will be paying a little extra for something better - there are lots of hotels in the same area and some of them must be better than this one !

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying for the price”
Reviews.Author: burkesilang
Reviews.Content: Very close to paddington, tube and only L13.90 round trip from heatrow apt by heatrow connect. Big Bus tour bus is just in front of the hotel, L24.00 for 2 days and can tour the sights in the city of london. Bathroom is small but typical in such places in europe, can live with it. Clean bed, sheets and towels to use after a whole day tour, of course that is all you want a good place to sleep. and of course a good heavy breakfast to start your day. only down side was the elevator was broke when we check in and check out. for a 2 star, thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, A Pleasant Stay!”
Reviews.Author: monchhichi1103
Reviews.Content: We were offered a double-bed room called "Duke of Wellington" on the first floor. It is spacious and the bed is very soft and comfortable. The toilet is big and the breakfast is acceptable. It is perhaps the best hotel we've stayed in London, in terms of price and location. It is conveniently located at the opposite of tube station, just 1-minute walk. The only problem is that electricity supply seems to be not very stable. We are told that in rare cases the room runs out of electricity supply. Other than that, we are happy to stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good review”
Reviews.Author: Jase28
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews on this hotel and was a bit concerned about it. I have to say that my experience at this hotel was absolutely fine. The hotel staff were very helpful and I stayed in a triple room which had loads of room and was spotlessly clean. The english breakfast was excellent. For the price this hotel is great. I would highly recommend and would definately stay there next time I visit London. Great position for Paddingtom and the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: DandJNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Hotel room clean but like the rest of the place poorly maintained and seriously in need of updating. Light bulb out in bedside lamp - lamp put aside so room maid must have seen it previously. Curtain hanging down. Window would not shut leaving gap. No remote TV [although not far to press buttons!] I could go on. Lift not working which from previous reviews is a regular problem. Breakfast fine although people queing to get in small b'fast room after us [8:15]. Main plus point for travellers like us coming from Heathrow is location straight opposite Paddington. Able to leave cases so were able to make most of the trip. Good bus service and tube into centre. Was disappointed receptionist wouldn't print our on line boarding passes though it was v quiet when asked. There is an internet cafe over the road however. Budget price = very low budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: Densue
Reviews.Content: Budget B&B hotel adjacent to Paddington rail & tube stations. Stayed on two occasions en route to and from the continent. On first night, was allocated a small room with very tiny en suite reached by going down two steep steps from bedroom - tricky in the night. Hardly enough room to swing the proverbial cat. Minimal furniture and a window looking out onto a flat roof covered with cigarette ends. However bed linen and floor clean.Creaky floors, banging doors and the noise of the tube trains made an early night's sleep difficult. On second night, was given a larger room overlooking Norfolk Square. This was much bigger with a queen size bed but only a double bed duvet. Again bed linen and floor clean. Large en suite bathroom and much quieter in the night. Overall, the hotel is in need of some renovation (carpets, decorations etc) but ok for an overnight stop depending on taste and budget. Breakfast reasonable but queues can form for a table depending on what time you want to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Moderate Price”
Reviews.Author: Candidreviewer4u
Reviews.Content: Nothing Fancy, typical London hotel with small rooms and outdated plumbing. The bathroom was pretty old and in need of updating but what do you expect, in London, for 80 pounds. Very convenient to London's not so convenient tube but if you don't mind the additional cost, the express train from Heathrow drops you at Paddington station within walking distance of the hotel. We had the typical amounts of luggage for Americans- way too much! But we managed just find despite the hotel's small elevator- at least there was one and it worked. The hotel breakfast was nice though the staff sort of make you feel they are doing you a major favor just by attending to your needs. I felt like asking for water with breakfast but couldn't work up the nerve. Despite the lack of an attentive staff, the manager was helpful, the charges were correct and I would stay again in the future. I prefer the Kensington area and would try any of the hotels there first, but for the price this one is hard to beat and I did my research before going.

Reviews.Title: “"Got what I expectedâ€�”
Reviews.Author: tuamotu
Reviews.Content: Our room 312 The room was small but clean and the beds were comfortable,. It's not luxury at royal norfolk hotel but look at the price (64Â£/night). the room had 2 single beds, a desk and chair, a mirror. and a tv; we were provided with towels. The hotel is centrally located, very close to underground and paddington station. the staff was very accommodating & pleasant other than one waiter at the breakfast room: probably he's not a gentleman!! Breakfast was downstairs in the common eating area:Cereal, orange-juice,coffee, milk or tea, full english breakfast or continental breakfast is provided. there is a small lift in the hotel and a storage room for luggage. The area was VERY quite: no noises at the night.

Reviews.Title: “April Fool”
Reviews.Author: grabcsma
Reviews.Content: Saw the reviews when looking for a hotel back in Feb and it seems to suggest that the hotel was better than the Hilton round the corner and had under gone some refurb NO WAY I can only assume the reviews which conned me where put on by the hotel it self I stayed here with my wife booking in on April Fools day fr 2 nights and to say it was a cow shed is unkind to cowsheds. The bedroom carpet in room 340 was disgusting as was the bathroom with black mould round the bath. The only way to open the curtains was to climb on the single bed shoe horned in The lift was so small it is lucky I still get on with my wife! I couldn't have taken it with anyone else. It has dark blue carpet on the walls and ceilings making it very clautrophobic/ To get to our room you had to take the lift to the 4th floor walk across a bridge and then down a flight of badly worn carpeted narrow stair case I would avoid it like the plague. That being said the staff where all lovely and polite The breakfast was good and it was very handy for Paddington Tube and Station

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: happy999
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and stayed here with a friend on the 8th February 2008 for two nights. Having read previous reviews I was wondering what the hotel would be like. We arrived early and the reception staff were most helpful and looked after our suitcases until we were able to check in at 2pm. We had Lunch in the pub below the hotel whilst we waited and it was nice. We were given room 312, it was a lovely sized twin room, the room was bright and plenty of space. The bathroom was also a reasonable size, it looked like a new bathroom suite, ok there was no shower curtain but then again you can make do without one. There was plenty of hot water and the towels were changed daily. The hotel is a non-smoking hotel. Breakfast was lovely orange juice; tea or coffee, two sausages, fried egg, bacon and baked beans, toast and jam, and I would recommend the cooked breakfast rather than the continental. We did see a single room in the hotel one morning and the room looked very small, but we had no complaints about our stay at the hotel at all. Once again when we checked out at noon we were able to leave our luggage in a secured room until it was time for our journeys home. The hotel is good value for money and so handy for the both the train and tube at Paddington Station, also I would recommend the Open Top Tour Bus which stops next to the Hotel a good way of seeing all the tourist sites of London. The Italian Restaurant almost opposite San Marco was excellent, great food and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there”
Reviews.Author: MNCMeath
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in Oct 07 what a dissapointment the hotel decor is out dated it needs a total overhaul its dirty. The rooms are sub standard the bathroom is the smallest room I have ever been in. You can't have a decent shower, the staff can just about speak English thats if you go to reception at the right time to be honest I loved London what a fab city but I was delighted to get out of that hotel to go home to sleep in my own bed and have a decent shower was heaven...... I have no idea how this hotel has a 3 star rating.............I would love to know how it got any type of rating as I would not rate it at all

Reviews.Title: “Not to bad”
Reviews.Author: SA_Traveller055
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Royal Norfolk Hotel, for 5 nights with my wife during Sept â€™07. The hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing purposes, close to tube, trains & buss stop, and not bad for the price paid. We arrived before the normal check-in time, but the friendly reception staff still allowed us to check in. Breakfast was included, and not bad. To be honest, itâ€™s not a â€œthree starâ€� hotel, but for the budget traveller perfect. Room and bathroom was clean but old, would have preferred a shower. Nice pubs and restaurants close by; avoid â€œSawters Armsâ€� across the road, pathetic service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!! Clean, good breakfast, great value...”
Reviews.Author: sunnysideup79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked this hotel in the summer of '04. We were looking for a place convenient to central London and mass transportation and Paddington has it all. This hotel was a very short walk from bus stops, the Tube, and the train station. The neighborhood was quiet and felt perfectly safe! The hotel itself is definitely for the budget crowd. If you're looking for luxury, this hotel is probably not for you. However, our room was clean (if a little small), the bed linens were fresh, and their full English breakfast was marvelous. We loved the view from the breakfast room and the windows were wide open to let in the cool morning air. We would definitely stay there again. It saved us a lot of money that we were then able to use to enjoy the rest of London.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Fine--Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Quastie1
Reviews.Content: My room was very tiny, but it was very clean and well decorated. I did not want to spend alot of money and this worked out very well. I will be staying there again in January. The location is fantastic. The Paddington tube station is literally across the street, and there is an Internet Cafe right across the street as well. The breakfast was very good. I would recommend it if you do not want to spend alot of money and want a clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is okay for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Dontrun
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a colleague in this hotel in a twin room for two nights. We had a spacious room with the window going out to the street. The room was clean and pleasant enough although in some places a little tatty. The bathroom was small and all the walls were covered in plastic from ceiling to floor. A downside was that the bath tub, being the shower at the same time, had no shower curtain. This made it hard to shower without flooding the rest of the bathroom. The bathroom was also unnaturally hot, which was odd as the heating was not turned on. I can confirm what other reviewers have said about the breakfast. That was really not very nice at all. There was very little choice and to serve exclusively pre-packaged, poor quality cheese was not pleasant. However, the staff were friendly and the breakfast service was fast. The hotel itself is in a very convenient location for getting around London and for getting to London Heathrow. I'd recommend it for a short stay if you are looking for budget accomodation in London.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: jomrtn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights last week. Room was clean, beds clean, towels were changed every day. Breakfast was very good. My only fault was the bathroom! It was smaller than a broom cupboard and only had hot water for about an hour in the mornings, none at all in the evening when you'd want to freshen up before going out. Overall though, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: CRobDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: This was one of my cheapest accommodation options for my one-night stay in central London in August 2007. The hotel is very handy for Paddington Station, which provides excellent underground links to the rest of London. I arrived before the normal check-in time, but the friendly reception staff still allowed me to check in. The walk from reception to my room (via the lift) was long and convoluted - not ideal for old people or if carrying heavy luggage. The single room was very small, possibly the smallest I've ever stayed in, but there was an en-suite shower room with toilet and basin. The furnishings were basic and in some cases cheap, and the room was not super-clean. The window overlooked a pleasant square at the rear of the hotel. The room was adequate for one night, especially considering I spent very little time in it. Breakfast was included in the price, but on entering the breakfast room I was told to wait outside. However, it was a short wait, and the dining room was pleasant and the breakfast was fine. On the whole, this hotel was acceptable for a short stay, and good value when compared with other central London hotels. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ElinaA
Reviews.Content: We stayed Royal Norfolk hotel 7.-9. of September. After reading reviws from here we were a bit concerned. But the hotel was nice! Staff were friendly and room/hallways were clean. I've been in London many times, so small room was what I expect, actually the room was bigger than I thought! Beds were soft and they even change my sisters pillowcase after one night (the dye in her hair made a slight mess). The shower was tiny, but we roll the shower curtain in to the corner and even me (big girl) fitted well. Extra plus that there were plenty of hot water and the pressure was fine! The location is exellent, just round the corner from Paddington station. Some people might not sleep well, but we didn't even notice the noise from trains. But we are city girls. ;) Only bad thing we could figure out was the curtains, they were ugly. :D I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. And if you don't like it, there is a Hilton next to the station. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: cara_le_chat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago, and we always shudder and look at it as we walk past enroute elsewhere - it is as grotty as Wildkim says, I wouldn't recommend it. We found the international staff were very pleasant and interesting, but the cooked breakfast was totally vile and inedible - toast and honey was the only safe option. The room was quite dirty. The area were the bath was sealed was mildewed, and the grouting was in need of replacement/ bleaching. As I've said before, Paddington is a real lottery where hotels are concerned, and you can't always make decisions based on other peoples' reviews - we got very badly let down recently, as a result !!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: frankDevon
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel room clean but with dated mismatched furniture. The bathroom was tiny, barely room to stand under the shower, and smelt unpleasant. Coming down to breakfast on the first morning we entered the dining room only to be told to wait outside as there was no room, we waited outside for about ten minutes before finally being allowed in. Breakfast was ok except on the last day when they ran out of bacon and we were given cold watery waferthin ham instead. The carpets in the hallways were filthy - the only pleasant thing about our stay were the reception staff who although ineffectual were very friendly. This hotel was advertised as a 3 star I can't believe it meets this standard. Would not book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again!”
Reviews.Author: wildkim
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel as part of a Superbreak.com package travelling from Belfast. This hotel was disgusting and should not even warrant "hotel" grading". The place was more like a hostel. Decor was out dated and grubby. Carpets dirty and I wont tell you what lurked behind the curtains . The shower was like a caravan shower with no room to manoever and we felt dizzy in such a confined small place. The shower head didnt work either. There was a smell of food in the room no doubt coming from the steak house below and even the linen smelt of cooking fat. I did not dare look at the matress, I just got drunk before bedtime in order to sleep. I wouldnt walk barefoot on the floors at all. The bedroom furniture was a mis match of various old furniture (not antique). Staff were not friendly and breakfast was cold so we ate out the other mornings. This place is not recommended for an enjoyable nor clean stay. I had treated my husband to this short trip as a birthday surprise and it was a big disappointment. Almost ended in D I V O R C E. I do not consider myself as over fussy but this place was of a very poor standard indeed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value For Money!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenlau07
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at the above hotel in June 2006 and thought it was great value for money hence why we booked with them again this year. I go to London every year in June to go to the Wimbledon tennis championships. The location of the hotel is great, so near the train and underground tube access. There's plenty of bars and restaurants which suited us down to the ground. On my recent stay last week, myself and two of my friends had a triple bed room booked for 27th of June to the 29th. Upon arriving and checking in we were told that we would be staying in one of the hotels apartments. Admittedly my first thought was "Oh no, its going to be one of those grotty bedsits". However we literally took a one minute walk down this small street and our apartment was the first one there. Opening the door I was totally surprised!!! We had our own modern fully useable kitchen, two double beds and a single, bathroom and lounge with tv. This apartment and the staff at the hotel made our stay in the city most enjoyable. I felt that strongly I even emailed the manager!! On reflection on the staff, the receptionist was soo nice and friendly and made sure that we were satisfied with our stay. She even commented that she hadnt seen us during breakfast and seemed concerned that we had missed it! The kitchen staff were great and were approachable if we wanted another cup of tea or more toast etc. I will definately be staying at the hotel in the near future. The only minor small negative I would say is that you can hear (from the apartment) trains going by throughout the night. However after you hear a couple you get use to it and drift off anyways!! I would STRONGLY recommend - great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Norfolk just fine”
Reviews.Author: teredew
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Royal Norfolk this June. Our room was a very clean twin with plenty of room for 2 people with 2 suitcases. The carpeting was new. The bath is like an RV bathroom, but we had plenty of hot water. The hallways and stairs were a bit shabby, but for the money, we felt this couldn't be beat in London. There are hotels around the corner that are renting rooms for 3 times what we paid at the Norfolk. The breakfasts were certainly adequate and in a lovely window-filled room. The night staff were a bit abrupt, but the day staff was very friendly. All were efficient. The last time we stayed in London was on a tour. Our room barely had room for a double bed, which was soft and lumpy and shoved in a corner. The breakfast room there was down in the basement and it was a depressing affair over-all. The Norfolk was a great improvement over that other establishment! I found the stairs and hallways going up and off in all directions rather fun. I think it was constructed that way so all rooms would have a window for ventilation. We did have a walking stick with us which I was glad of because we used that to secure the window and were then able to leave it open about 6" at night and felt secure. It was very comfortable to sleep and not very noisy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again unless they improved the access”
Reviews.Author: ChirpyTraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked with my rail ticket online. The hotel is just across the road from the entrance to Paddington mainline and underground stations - so that was convenient. Within 10 minutes of leaving the station I was making tea in my room. However, the access to my single room which was on the fourth floor of the building next to the main hotel, was either by a tiny lift - room for 2 without luggage maybe? - lined with dark blue carpet and felt like I imagine a coffin would feel - or numerous flights of stairs leading to an outside "fire escape type" steps going down slightly, to the next building. I felt like Mary Poppins up amongst the chimneys! Then, in through a fire door to a place that wasn't nearly as nice as the main buiding had appeared. You had to use the outside steps even if you used the lift and I heard other people saying they weren't going to use that lift again! There didn't seem to be a proper fire escape. The instructions were to use the main stairs if there was a fire. My room was very small but just about OK - for a few hours. Bed seemed clean, but hard. Kept the window closed and it was quiet - but might be very hot in the summer I should think. Tiny moulded plastic tea tray/kettle with the basics. Built in plastic cabin type bathroom - tiny, reminded me of a cheap ferry cabin, cheap soap and shower gel. But it was OK. Carpet grubby with cigarette burns, curtains - very heavy elaborate ones - hanging off rail in middle. Furniture - not that there was room for much, not even a chair - cheap, very basic. Small TV worked OK. Didn't try the phone as my mobile worked. No restaurant - I think the ones mentioned are really other nearby businesses that they have arranged access to via internal doors. The breakfast room is on the first floor of the main building. Check that you have booked for a full English breakfast if that is what you want. A Chinese girl sitting next to me was asked if she wanted English and after eventually saying yes and waiting she was told she had only booked for continental breakfast and would have to pay extra. My English breakfast was quite well cooked. I didn't try the orange juice or bread etc. I had paid Â£50 for one night - months in advance with my rail ticket. But I saw several websites offering the same thing for up to Â£8 cheaper a few days before I actually went. But it would have been a risk leaving it that late to book The main part of the hotel seemed well decorated - the stairways at least - and conditions may be much better there. The receptionist and the waiter were both very polite. I dId not think it worth asking for a better room as it was such a short stay. I took lots of pictures which are not available at time of writing but will upload them later, if that is possible.

Reviews.Title: “lovley place!”
Reviews.Author: claireNorthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the internet then read the reviews! My husband and i were very worried about this 1st stay in london because of all the bad reviews this hotel had got! We need not have worried on arrival we were checked in by the very helpful and polite receptionist,he informed us of all the details we needed to know, breakfast ect....Yes the bedrooms are a little small but very clean and warm, i also agree with others about the bathroom/shower very small but fine for the amount of time you would have to spend in it, We enjoyed the full english which was once again served by very polite and friendly staff, dining area was quite big, we really enjoyed our stay (2 nights) at this hotel and would def return.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously... 3 star hotel? I don't think so!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TH13
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location. Thank God there are more than 20 other hotels in that area, so don't bother to pick this one! I found it on the internet and a 3star rating seemed quite promising. I don't know who gave this rating to this hotel, but they were either blind or crazy! I went with my mother on the 3rd of February and stayed for 7 nights. Here's our experience: Upon arrival, we were informed that someone reserved for us a double room although our reservation was for a TWIN -and as promised by the manager- SPACIOUS room. They managed to get us a twin room, which was probably the smallest hotel room in history ever! (Not to mention the condition of the bathroom: there were FLAKES OF PAINT COMING OUT OF THE BATHTUB!) There wasn't even space to put our luggage. When we complained about that, they said that usually people don't bring two suitcases with them! If you ask me, there wasn't space for not even one suitcase but according to the guy at the reception that's what the nightstand between the beds is for! And if we made a little rearrangement with the chair and the TV, we would manage to fit the second suitcase, although then we wouldn't be able to open the door... Eventually they discovered that there was a larger room available from the next day and we were so happy to hear about that, that we managed to overcome the fact that our room had no heating and that we had to wait for the porter to switch it on THE NEXT MORNING! The new room was almost what the website was promising, but I must say that having to spend FIVE nights on the same sheets and FIVE days on a carpet that was never vacuumed wasn't that comfortable! The next surprise was when we found out that WE HAD TO PAY TO GET A REMOTE FOR THE TV. Fortunately, we brought our own adaptors, or we had had to pay for them also! And that wasn't hardly all... Most of the staff was almost UNABLE TO COMMUNICATE IN PROPER ENGLISH and -apart from two young ladies who were attending reception in the mornings- they were also RUDE! Every evening, when I entered the hotel and said "hello" I didn't even get one smile as a reply! Smiles were also missing from the breakfast room, as well as orange juice! In fact it was probably replaced with water with sugar and orange colour! Last, but not at all least, when we unpacked we found out that we forgot in our room two adaptors and two rucksacks. Although we returned to the hotel 3 hours after we checked out (to get our luggage) and although my phone number and e-mail are known to the hotel staff, no one bothered to contact us. Someone would expect a little more attention to the guests' belongings from a hotel that practically rents its own (remote controls and adaptors)! If, in spite of all of the above, you decide to stay at this hotel make sure to ask for one of the refurbished rooms, bring extra cash to pay for the remote, buy some orange juice from one of the mini markets across the street and don't forget anything in your room because you will instantly kiss it goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms by the hour!”
Reviews.Author: Properjob
Reviews.Content: I would have been better to sleep on Paddington Station. Dirty, rude, cold etc etc. Very cheap in every sense. DO NOT GO THERE

Reviews.Title: “Depressingly dire!”
Reviews.Author: GenXtravellerGirl
Reviews.Content: We had booked this via an on-line web-site and it was fairly misleading - not at all what we expected from the photos. The carpet was filthy, it stank of stale cigarette smoke (despite being advised that it was non-smoking). The windows were filthy and the bathroom was old and stained. There was no fridge in the room either to store drinks etc. The lifts were too small to take more than one person and a bag - so this made it very difficult for my husband and I to get all our luggage up. We had single beds and the doona was too small. It was like someone had cut a single doona in half and used that. It only just reached the edge of the bed and that was without anyone sleeping under it. So when, you slept and turned you had a cold draft at your back. The breakfast was slow and we always had to ask for things - like cutlery. The toast was cold and so was the rest of the cooked breakfast. Maybe they didn't have enough staff to do the service though? The location was good, but it was extremely noisy as well since is was so close to Paddington Station. At one point, I just sat there are cried - it was so depressing.

Reviews.Title: “worst night in an hotel ....EVER!”
Reviews.Author: honest-midwife
Reviews.Content: Room tiny, cold,noisy as not double glazed, no lights, ensuite smaller than most toilets- you could brush your teeth, shower and have a wee at the same time. Waitress rude and tried to charge me again for the english breakfast and guess what, everyone had to queue to get in the restaurant. Would recommend park bench over this "hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear !!!”
Reviews.Author: PoppyH13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mate last weekend (2-3 dec 2006) and i have to say it is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in. In fact to call it a hotel is a joke. n arrival at Paddington station we got outside and saw the hotel not far across the road and were delighted with our choice, well that was until we got closer. Even from the outside it was obvious it had seen better days. The reception area was very basic and didnt look clean. The receptionist struggled to lift her head to even acknowledge that we were standing in front of her. We checked in and got in the ancient lift that could take 2 people at a push. There was dirty laundry lying all over the stairs and passageways and no hotel staff including the cleaners even acknowledged you when walking past them. When eventually finding our room "the duke of york" room 323 ha ha we could not believe our eyes, the room smelled stale, on the surface it appeared clean but only just. The beds were clean but the carpet wasnt, the curtains looked like they'd not been cleaned for a few years and then the bathroom, oh my god, there was a toilet/shower and it was hard to tell where the toilet finished and the shower started, you can hardly turn round without bashing your arms on either side of the walls, a total disgrace. We actually considered showering in paddington station, the toilets there are a palace compaired to the ROYALL NORFOLK HOTEL!! there is nothing royal about it!! We complained and were offered another room which was equally as bad but believe it or not even smaller. I could go on and on and on but the bottom line is, do not book this hotel even if there is absolutely no other hotel anywhere else in London, book at your peril !!!

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: holady
Reviews.Content: excellent location, right opposite paddington station and underground. This made it easy to see the sights anywhere in London. The Big Bus company also stopped right outside so you could purchase a hop on - hop off ticket lasting 24 hrs for Â£20. The price included either a live guided tour or a recorded tour of all the famous landmarks (plus a free sail down the Thames). The hotel itself had a nice reception area with friendly staff. The room was a little bit of a let down as it was quite small with tatty furniture (but nevertheless clean). The ensuite bathroom was down a couple of steps and reminded me of a bathroom you'd have in a caravan. Very small with a fan instead of a window. The shower took a little while to warm up but then it was fine. There was a wall mounted hairdryer in the bedroom. Whilst we were there the lift was out of order. My sister and husband were on the 4th floor so this was a great inconvenience to them. I don't know how long it had been out of order as there was a notice on the door saying that it would be fixed as soon as possible and someone had written on it " When!?" There was a nice little pub next door with an adjoining entrance to the hotel and also a steak house on the other side. However I don't recommend the steakhouse. There were numerous eating establishments and bars in the immediate viccinity. I would definitely stay here again on my next sightseeing trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: bassetlawbadger
Reviews.Content: Living proof that no matter how you try to avoid chains and support individual hotels you really should stick to what you know! I booked this 3 star as a family surprise and was embarrassed. I should have stuck to what I know and booked a Premier Lodge/Novotel etc - it cost the same! The underground thunders past - the bathroom is unusable and breakfast a joke. Please, please, please don't book it even if it looks like a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful!”
Reviews.Author: MrStraightTalker
Reviews.Content: I wish that I read other reviews of this hotel before I booked a single room for one night in October 2006. The hotel's location is ideal in the heart of Paddington. However, the hotel is not the warmest place that I have stayed and also needs a makeover. My room was on the 4th floor and one of the tiniest hotel rooms I've seen. Turning around in the shower was impossible, although I must say that the bedroom and bathroom were both clean. Breakfast was an interesting experience. We had to wait to get into the small restaurant and once sat down I was greeted by a dirty teapot from which I was expected to pour my morning drink. My 'continental' breakfast was one of a kind. Two pieces of ham were accompanied by two slices of processed cheese - still in their wrappers. Fortunately I was only in the hotel for 7-8 hours. I must say that this experience was certainly not good value for money at Â£55. Finally, other guests who I spoke to were making similar comments. This hotel could be great but needs improving before this can be reality.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all .”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTwo
Reviews.Content: Smallest room we have ever stayed in with smallest bathroom ever seen, to use the sink you have to put one foot in the shower. The carpets and curtains were filthy but at least the bed sheets had been changed (i think). Although London is generally pricey this dump charged Â£75 a night for a double room on the 3rd floor with no working lift. Thankfully we only stayed one night and will definately not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “poor problem solving”
Reviews.Author: wazuck
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for a week, room and bedding was very clean, but shower and toilet must have been built for midgets!!, the lift wasn't working for the entire week, which made things very difficult for my wife who is recovering from a broken leg!! stair carpet was threadbare in many places, and the cleaners had the VERY DANGEROUS habit of jamming the fire doors open with wedges, (overnight)

Reviews.Title: “Dire hotel”
Reviews.Author: EH6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dire! Dirty rooms, peeling wallpaper, unpleasant smells. Lastminute.com says that it is a 3-star hotel, but it resembles a 1-star. Room 122 is a tiny box with a small barred window looking onto a filthy stairwell loaded with rotting rubbish. The filthy bathroom has cracked lino. The fittings are ancient, cracked and broken. A sign on the back of the door warns you not to leave your possessions in the room and to lock the window. We recommend that you avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: kaminski
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotel-london.co.uk. Arrived early and was told to come back at 1pm by a very apologetic lady at the check in who let me left my luggage in their store room. Came back at 1pm and was given a room on the fourth floor. I got a huge suitcase with me at that time. Thought it was okay as the hotel have a lift. Wrong! The lift was out of order that day and I begged with the lady (who was charming earlier) for a room on the lower floor as I would be struggling with my luggage all the way up the stairs. Apparently theres nothing she can do as she watched me going up the stairs with a 20kg suitcase...yes all the way up thrugh narrow staircase and what I would described as a maze. Walked in to my room, which for once I thought I was in the store room downstairs again but to my shock and horror..it was my room..single room which I could hardly open my suitcase apart from having to open it on the bed itself. Carpet was shabby and dirty. The room is so small and maybe the aircraft toilet would resemble the toilet in that room. I must say the bedsheet is clean. Other than that, I strongly suggest to avoid this hotel at any cost. As for breakfast, I did leave early but even if I were to stay till late, I wouldn't want to have breakfast at this god forsaken place.

Reviews.Title: “An "interesting" experience.”
Reviews.Author: snib
Reviews.Content: Since it's an island I didnt expect an exceptionally large room, especially not for the money, but the single room was really a shoebox, and I personally hate plastic "bathrooms". Anyhow, I noticed that the heating was not working, which was not nice since it was still kind of cold outside. So I asked for the problem being solved, and was given another room. Surprisingly it was a twin room, but still with a plastic bathroom... The heating worked there, but the window would not close properly, I didnt bother complaining anymore. The room was rather clean, but there was something undefinable on the wall. Anyhow for a budget hotel it was alright and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very cheap but looks it”
Reviews.Author: EamonnC
Reviews.Content: The smallest room I have ever stayed in with a tiny bathroom similar to what you'd find on a boat. Breakfast wasn't worth the effort. The room was clean and the location great. For this price in London it is probably as good as you will get.

Reviews.Title: “A good 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: TheGuitarman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our first trip to london. I booked this hotel for 3 nights, room 311, on the laterooms web site, Â£44 for a double en-suite with continental breakfast. Not bad I thought. Most of the other reviews are accurate and I wouldn't have liked to pay any more then I did, However, The location is Ideal for newcomers to london, The Tube 50 yds across the road, the BIG BUS stops virtually outside the hotel,The Sawyers Pub is across the road, good food and a cracking pint. I upgraded my Breakfast to a "full English" for Â£2, and ate as much toast as I kept asking for, which kept me going all day till I got back to the Sawyers for my Steak. The room had TV, Hi Fi, Kettle with tea and cofee, Hair dryer, daily clean towels and bed made up,the En-suite was quite nice with a large bath with overhead shower no curtain though so I had a piping hot bath every day with unlimited hot water. The negatives were a grossly out of level floor(or was it the Sawyers)central heating didn't work although they had an electric heater which was ok and we left it on 24/7. It wasn't dirty or smelly and I would stop there again at the right price. Now, NEWCOMERS to London, DO get a Travelcard for your duration absolutly essential, This was my first time on the tube, when are we getting one in Nottingham ? Ratings out of 10:- St Pauls, 10. London Bridge,7. Tower of London, 10. London Eye, 6. London Aquarium,2. HMS Belfast,7. Harrods,5. Museums near to Harrods,8. Big Bus, expensive but very handy on first day. The south Bank from London Bridge to Westminster bridge is a nice walk. I printed a street map of the web with just the area I was interested in,Hyde Park to London bridge, It had all the Tube station marked, I found it invaluable and didn't get lost once. ENJOY YOUR TRIP

Reviews.Title: “Only for short term stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The main thing I disliked about the room was the state of the carpet, it was absolutely filthy and heavily stained. The room itself was adequately equipped with 2 x single beds, clean bedclothes and clean towels left every day, a small wardrobe and a dressing table/desk but no drawers. The curtains were falling off the rail and would not meet in the middle so I secured them together with pins!! The bathroom was a good size, no shower curtain though. We had a problem with the toilet not flushing, this was reported and supposedly repaired but failed to work every now and again. The breakfast was adequate but be early as on one occasion there were approx 10/12 persons waiting outside and we had to wait for some others to leave before we could go in. All in all I suppose you get what you pay for but it is badly in need of a good overhaul and modernisation but most of all a thorough clean. On the other hand it is in a prime location close to Paddington Station, buses, shops and restaurants and is ideally situated.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and outdated”
Reviews.Author: Nikka
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the reviews before staying here. I thought I had found a great deal booking this hotel online. The only good thing to say about it is the location which was great, right by Paddington station for the heathrow express and all the buses and tubes. Unfortunately, the room was dirty and outdated. there were stains on the walls, bedspreads, carpet and ceiling. The original features was found in the fact that nothing had been updated... I could barely see in the bathroom as it was so dark. The breakfast room as pleasant but breakfast only consisted of cornflakes and a fruit yogurt. When my friend tried to specify WHICH type of fruit yogurt he wanted, his request was denied. Overall, stay here for location only, not for a treat!

Reviews.Title: “One night enough.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a over night stop for the Heathrow express because of its location to Paddington station, that's the only good thing about it. We left the facade of the reception area, and headed to our room, carrying our suitcases up and down numerous stairs, once there we found it somewhat, well how can I put this? It was supposed to be for two people, what a laugh you couldnâ€™t even swing a cat. As for the bathroom if your 6ft like me then all I can say is that I hope you are a contortionist, my wife is 5 foot 3 and had trouble moving about. Before checking out we went for breakfast in the hotel, we ordered the continental breakfast and received the following: two thin slices of pre packed ham, one slice of toast and two cheese slices (still in their rapper),I have never seen anything like it. Please heed my warning look somewhere else, there are plenty of other hotels in the area for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed here three years in a row. The view of London Street is great. English breakfast is wonderful. Room is small but nice. Location is outstanding if you don't mind all the changes via Paddington tube station. I plan on staying here again this summer if I can. So please save me Room 214 for mid-June or mid-August.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom challenge”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights here last week. Room was ok if a bit dingy, window to internal yard - but very quiet. Smallest bathroom I have experienced (apart from on boats and trains). I am not tall (5.9) but was challenged to stand upright in bathroom! Found the staff ok. Best feature is breakfast room and the quality of the breakfast is above average for this standard of hotel. Very convenient for Paddington.

HotelInfo.Name: Royal Norfolk Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25 London Street | Norfolk Square, London W2 1HH, England
